snippet: Couples could start marrying by next week as a federal appeals court panel denied a request to delay its ruling striking down Virginia’s ban on same-sex marriages.
abstract: United States Court of Appeals for Fourth Circuit in Richmond, VA, refuses to stay its decision striking down state's ban on same-sex unions; unless Supreme Court intercedes, Virginia counties can shortly begin issuing marriage licenses to gay couples.
lead_paragraph: Couples could start marrying by next week as a federal appeals court panel denied a request to delay its ruling striking down Virginia’s ban on same-sex marriages.

headline.main: Court Refuses to Stay Its Decision Striking Down Virginia’s Same-Sex Marriage Ban
headline.print_headline: Court Refuses to Stay Its Decision Striking Down Virginia’s Same-Sex Marriage Ban

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
